title: Question:
author: talkoncrypto Official
content: Do you have any opinion in support of your choice ??

comments.author: LoyceMobile
comments.body: It doesn't matter, it's an arbitrary choice. As long as it's publicly known and doesn't change, the market decides the rest.

comments.author: franky1
comments.body: what if i told you that if you read the raw/real data of the value of a "1btc" tx being transacted.. its not "1btc" but 100,000,000 unitsbitcoin uses 'satoshis' where a 1btc is a convenience display allotment for easy human eye readingof satoshi/100,000,000=1btcmuch like gold is picto grams(atoms) but combined into ounces and kg for easy human handlingbitcoin is fixed to its satoshi units(hard/true data on blockchain). and then calculates up from there to translated basket terms in the wallet/node displaythere will be upto 2,099,999,997,690,000 fixed(hard data/rule) units of share-ability..by the time all fixed rule halving events have done their course

comments.author: Little Mouse
comments.body: You should add one more option- doesn't matter. As long as it remains the same supply and doesn't get changed (which is impossible as doing so will create another chain, aka altcoin), there's nothing wrong with that. I don't exactly know what satoshi had in his mind when he fixed the supply(I can't remember if I have ever read any explanation), but my opinion would be the same if the supply was 42 million or even more but a fixed one, not like unlimited as we have in our centralized currency.
